page.title: 01SAFFRON WALDEN
page.content: Saffron Walden is in the centre of our 12 square kilometres. It is a market town surrounded by farmland. The nearest large towns are Cambridge to the north and Bishop's Stortford to the south. Saffron Walden's importance as a market town has decreased over the last two decades. This is because there has been a move to arable farming and because the town has grown as a residential are for people who work outside the area. More than half the working population commute to work outside the town. The main places to which they go are Cambridge, Stortford, Harlow and London. A lot of new housing has been built in the last 15 years. The population has doubled to 18 tousand.
